intro: Caiophora lorentziana, commonly known as the Lorentziana Caiophora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Caiophora lorentziana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
